net.parallaxed.bluejam
Class NoteLeafSet

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractSet<Terminal>
          net.parallaxed.bluejam.TerminalSet
              net.parallaxed.bluejam.NoteLeafSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<Terminal>, java.util.Collection<Terminal>, java.util.Set<Terminal>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ScaledSet
public class NoteLeafSet
extends TerminalSet

The note set of all possible pitch classes in the octave range supplied to the constructor. TODO Unit test for this...

Author:
Ciarán Rowe (csr2@kent.ac.uk)

Constructor Detail

NoteLeafSet

public NoteLeafSet()
Trivial constructor does nothing if we're using one of the subclasses.

NoteLeafSet

public NoteLeafSet(int minOctave,
                   int maxOctave)
Constructs a NoteLeafSet constrained by octave range. Each range starts on A and ends on Ab, so a range of 4-5 yields all notes between A4-Ab5.

Parameters:
minOctave -
maxOctave -
Method Detail

add

public boolean add(Terminal t)
Overrides the superclass' add function to ensure only NoteLeaf instances are added to this set.

Specified by:

add in interface java.util.Set<Terminal>
Overrides:

setRange

public void setRange(int minOctave,
                     int maxOctave)
Sets the maximum range of the notes being played. maxOctave must be >= minOctave

Parameters:
minOctave -
maxOctave -

getRandom

public NoteLeaf getRandom(NoteSequence n)
Returns a random terminal that is likely to fit with the current model, knowing that the last terminal is of a given pitch. Note that this only takes into consideration the very last note of the note sequence. If no model has been set, simply returns a terminal from vanilla getRandom().

Parameters:
n - The NoteSequence preceding the current note.

getRandom

public NoteLeaf getRandom(Note n)

public void setModel(PitchModel model)
              throws java.lang.Exception
Sets the model that this NoteLeaf set should use.

Parameters:
model -
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
